AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Officer who conducted a traffic stop of Ignacio Rodriguez, issued a citation, and informed him that the vehicle could not continue to its destination
Defendant stopped by Officer Reyes, driver of the black truck, exhibited nervous behavior during the stop, claimed the vehicle belonged to his aunt and then his cousin, transported to a checkpoint for further questioning, contends that Officer Reyes exceeded the scope of a traffic stop
Defendant in the case who had his vehicle stopped by a United States Border Patrol agent and is a United States citizen, challenges the stop of his white sedan
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, stationed at the Freer checkpoint for a year and a half, familiar with ninety to ninety-five percent of the vehicles passing down FM 2050, pursued the defendants and conducted registration checks, explained his suspicions and actions during a traffic stop, made observations of passengers' behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett: Involved in the case, mentioned during the cross examination of Agent Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: United States Border Patrol Agent who received a phone call regarding the traffic stop of Ignacio Rodriguez, arrived at the scene to assist Officer Reyes, transported Ignacio Rodriguez to a checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security involved in investigating an attempted alien smuggling event, testified about the interview with Ignacio Rodriguez
